page.title: 10Forestry at Chatsworth
page.content: The main areas of woodland in this block lie on the two escarpments behind and to the east of the House. Stand Wood is managed mainly for amenity and has many pleasant walks. There are many types of trees from very young to very old. At a higher elevation is Bunkers Hill which is largely commercial conifer plantings. There are several small woods in the valley bottom to the west of the House and the management here is intended to produce visually pleasant woods comprising mainly high quality broadleaved trees also suitable for pheasant shooting. There are eleven staff in the Forestry Department who manage the woods on traditional methods with up to date equipment.
